actions.committee: Senate Committee on Commerce (Subsequently: Commerce, Science, and Transportation)
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Commerce (Subsequently: Commerce, Science, and Transportation).

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Aviation Act of 1958, as amended, by requiring certification and subsidy of at least two air carriers to points receiving neither highway nor railroad service.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to prohibit the inclusion or continuation of any term or condition in an air carrier's certificate of public convenience and necessity which limits the maximum subsidy amounts payable with respect to service to or from points which receive neither railroad nor highway service. Directs the Civil Aeronautics Board in the performance of its duties to consider the certification of at least two air carriers which will provide service to such points as being necessary to the development of a sound air transportation system and the national defense.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Aviation Act of 1958, as amended, by requiring certification and subsidy of at least two air carriers to points receiving neither highway nor railroad service.
